Package ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit

Class JSourceCodeEditor

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.JSourceCodeEditor
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable
public class JSourceCodeEditor extends JComponent
A text editing component that provides syntax highlighting, macro recording, and other features suited for editing formal languages (such as programming and markup languages). Using the editor typically consists of the following steps:
  1. Create a new editor instance. If you wish to change the default editor configuration, for example to change the style used to display some part of the target source language, you can either create the editor with a custom EditorConfiguration instance or call the relevant setters on the editor.
  2. Set a Tokenizer suitable for the target language. This will cause the editor to apply appropriate syntax highlighting and other language-specific features.
  3. If desired, add custom commands and bind them to appropriate key strokes.
  4. If desired, set an abbreviation table. An abbreviation table allows the user to expand mnemonic abbreviations to longform equivalents.
  5. If desired, set a code completer. A code completer typically helps the user complete a partially typed class, function, or variable name. While an abbreviation always has a single unique expansion, performing a code completion command usually results in several possible options being displayed.
  6. Set the initial document text, if any.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • FILE_DROP_PROPERTY

      public static final String FILE_DROP_PROPERTY
      The name of the property change event that is fired when files are dropped while the file drop feature is enabled. The new value of the property is an immutable List of the files that have been dropped. If a listener decides not to handle the file drop after all, for example, if the files are not the right type, then it can throw an UnsupportedOperationException. This will prevent the selection from changing to the drop point, but otherwise has no effect.
      See Also:
      setFileDropEnabled(boolean), Constant Field Values

    • setContextMarginLineCount

      public final void setContextMarginLineCount​(int contextMarginLines)
      Sets the number of lines from the top and bottom of the text area at which scrolling begins. For example, if this is set to two and the caret moves up to the second visible line, then the window will be scrolled (if possible) so that there are still two lines visible above the caret
      Parameters:
      contextMarginLines - the number of lines of context to show at the top and bottom of the window

    • setAbbreviationTable

      public final void setAbbreviationTable​(AbbreviationTable at)
      Sets the editor's abbreviation table. The abbreviation table is a table of short strings that can be typed into the document and then expanded, typically by pressing Tab.
      Parameters:
      at - the table to set, or null to disable abbreviations
      See Also:
      getAbbreviationTable()

    • getAbbreviationTable

      public int getLineEndOffset​(int line)
      Returns the end offset of the specified line.
      Parameters:
      line - the line index
      Returns:
      the offset at which the specified line ends, or -1 if the index is invalid

    • convertColumnToLineOffset

      public int convertColumnToLineOffset​(int line, int column)
      Returns the line offset for a column. Line offsets do not always map to column numbers since tab characters may cover a variable number of columns. This method converts a column into a character offset from the start of a line, taking tabs and the document tab size into account.
      Parameters:
      line - the line index
      column - the column at which the offset is displayed
      Returns:
      offset from the start of the line, in characters

    • convertLineOffsetToColumn

      public int convertLineOffsetToColumn​(int line, int offset)
      Returns the column for a line offset. Line offsets do not always map to column numbers since tab characters may cover a variable number of columns. This method converts a character offset from the start of a line to a column, taking tabs and the document tab size into account.
      Parameters:
      line - the line index
      offset - offset from the start of the line, in characters
      Returns:
      column at which the offset is displayed

    • getLineLength

      public int getLineLength​(int line)
      Returns the length of the specified line.
      Parameters:
      line - the line index
      Returns:
      the length of th specified line

    • getText

      public final String getText​(int offset, int length)
      Returns the specified substring of the document.
      Parameters:
      offset - the start offset
      length - the length of the substring
      Returns:
      the specified substring, or null if the parameters are invalid

    • getText

      public final void getText​(int offset, int length, Segment segment)
      Copies the specified substring of the document into a segment. If the offsets are invalid, the segment will contain an empty string.
      Parameters:
      offset - the start offset
      length - the length of the substring
      segment - the segment to use to store the substring

      Parameters:
      line - the line index
      segment - the segment to use to store the line text

    • isEditable

      Returns:

    • setEditable

      Sets whether this component is editable.
      Parameters:
      editable - true if editing is allowed

    • overwriteSelectedText

      public void overwriteSelectedText​(String text)
      Replaces the selection with the specified text. If the selection is empty and overwrite mode is enabled, then the specified text replaces a corresponding number of characters in the document. If overwrite mode is not enabled, the string is inserted as if setSelectedText(java.lang.String) was called.
      Parameters:
      text - the text to write into the editor
      See Also:
      isOverwriteEnabled()

    • isOverwriteEnabled

      public final boolean isOverwriteEnabled()
      Returns whether overwrite mode is enabled.
      Returns:
      true if overwrite mode is enabled
      See Also:
      setOverwriteEnabled(boolean)

    • setOverwriteEnabled

      public final void setOverwriteEnabled​(boolean overwrite)
      Sets whether overwrite mode is enabled. When enabled, typing will replace the character under the caret instead of inserting it.
      Parameters:
      overwrite - if true, typed characters will overwrite the document text
      See Also:
      isOverwriteEnabled()

    • isSelectionRectangular

      Returns:

    • cut

      public void cut()
      Deletes the selected text and places it on the clipboard.
      See Also:
      copy(), paste()

    • copy

      public void copy()
      Places the selected text on the clipboard.
      See Also:
      cut(), paste()

    • paste

      public void paste()
      Inserts the contents of the system clipboard into the editor. This has no effect if the editor is not editable or if the clipboard is empty or does not contain text.
      See Also:
      cut(), copy(), paste(java.awt.datatransfer.Clipboard)

    • paste

      public void paste​(Clipboard clipboard)
      Inserts the contents of the specified clipboard into the editor. This has no effect if the editor is not editable or if the clipboard is empty or does not contain text.
      Parameters:
      clipboard - the clipboard to get content from
      See Also:
      cut(), copy(), paste()

    • processComponentKeyEvent

      protected void processComponentKeyEvent​(KeyEvent keyEvent)
      Processes key events by forwarding them to the input handler. If the input handler is null, the method does nothing. Note that the focus manager and any attached key listeners will have an opportunity to process (and consume) the event first.
      Overrides:
      processComponentKeyEvent in class JComponent
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - the key event being processed

    • addCaretListener

      Adds a caret change listener to this editor.
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to inform of caret position changes

    • removeCaretListener

      public final void removeCaretListener​(CaretListener listener)
      Removes a caret change listener from this editor.
      Parameters:
      listener - the listener to stop informing of caret position changes

    • fireCaretEvent

      protected void fireCaretEvent()
      Called to inform registered listeners of a change in caret position.

    • updateBracketHighlight

      protected void updateBracketHighlight​(int newCaretPosition)

    • documentChanged

      protected void documentChanged​(DocumentEvent evt)

    • setFileDropEnabled

      public void setFileDropEnabled​(boolean enabled)
      Sets whether dropping files on the editor will fire a property change event. If disabled, dropping files will not be allowed. If enabled, and the user drops files on the component, the cursor will be moved to the drop point and a FILE_DROP_PROPERTY property change event will be fired. This allows you to add custom handling for dropping files on the editor without replacing the default transfer handler.
      Parameters:
      enabled - if true, enable file dropping (default is false)

    • isFileDropEnabled

      public boolean isFileDropEnabled()
      Returns true if dropping a file is enabled and will cause a property change event to be fired.
      Returns:
      true if file drops are enabled
      See Also:
      FILE_DROP_PROPERTY

      See Also:
      isBracketHighlightEnabled()
